msIdentifier.repository: Library at the Herbert D. Katz Center for Advanced Judaic Studies

msContents.summary: A versified Arabic-Persian glossary facilitating the study of Arabic language and prosody. Words are explained in the form of qiṭʻahs composed in various meters. This copy is missing a page between leaves 2 and 3

persName.#text: Farāhī, Abū Naṣr Muḥammad Badr al-Dīn
فراهي، ابو نصر محمد بدر الدين

name.#text: Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning

supportDesc.extent: 54 leaves : 200 x 122 (180 x 77) mm bound to 195 x 120 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in eight staggered half lines.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in neat nastaʻlīq in black ink; pointed.

binding.p: Reddish brown leather over pasteboard (Type III); blind stamped central lobed mandorla with two pendants on the vertical axis; turn-ins are starting to come up.

origin.p: The item is not dated or signed; possibly produced in the 18th century.

provenance: Gift of Mayer Sulzberger to the library of the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (note on library bookplate, inside front cover).
Formerly owned by the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (library bookplate inside front cover).

term: Arabic language--Glossaries, vocabularies, etc.--Early works to 1800
